text: Matthew George "Matt" Reeves (born April 27, 1966) is an American screenwriter, director and producer. ==Career== Reeves began his career as a screenwriter for the movies Under Siege 2: Dark Territory (1995) and The Pallbearer (1996). He then worked into television as a director and co-creator of the drama series Felicity (1998â€“2002) alongside J.J. Abrams. Reeves has since directed the found-footage horror movie Cloverfield (2008), the romantic horror movie Let Me In (2010), and the science fiction sequels Dawn of the Planet of the Apes (2014) and War for the Planet of the Apes (2017). In February 2017, Warner Bros. announced that Reeves would direct The Batman, released in 2022 and starring Robert Pattinson as the titular character. ==Movies== Year Title Credited as Notes Director Writer Producer 1993 Future Shock Segment: "Mr. Petrified Forest" 1995 Under Siege 2: Dark Territory Co- written with Richard Hatem 1996 The Pallbearer Co-written with Jason Katims 2000 The Yards Co-written with James Gray 2008 Cloverfield 2010 Let Me In 2014 Dawn of the Planet of the Apes 2017 War for the Planet of the Apes Co-written with Mark Bomback 2022 The Batman ==References== ==Other websites== * * LAist.com Interview with Matt Reeves Category:1966 births Category:Living people Category:Movie directors from New York (state) Category:Movie producers from New York (state) Category:Screenwriters from New York (state) Category:People from Rockville Centre, New York
